articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: Israel's ambassador to the United Nations on Sunday accused Palestinian Islamist group Hamas of war crimes, vowing that it was time to "obliterate Hamas terror infrastructure," as the U.N. Security Council met to discuss the conflict.
articles.title: Israel UN envoy decries 'war crimes,' UN Security Council meets

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Islamic Jihad chief Ziad al-Nakhala said on Sunday that his faction was holding captive more than 30 of the Israelis who were abducted in the Gaza Strip since Saturday after Hamas launched attacks on Israel.
articles.title: Islamic jihad faction holding over 30 Israelis captive, its chief says

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Gaza Strip has suffered its deadliest day in 15 years in the wake of the unprecedented attack by Hamas into Israel, with Israeli air strikes killing nearly 300 Palestinians in 24 hours, according to Palestinian officials.
articles.title: Gaza Strip suffers deadliest day in 15 years after Hamas attack

articles.author: Dan Williams
articles.description: Hundreds of stunned Israelis filed into a central police station on Sunday hoping for word on the fate of loved ones lost in the wake of a mass Palestinian infiltration from the Gaza Strip.
articles.title: Israelis desperately seek word on missing kin from Hamas attack

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United Arab Emirates on Sunday described attacks carried out by Palestinian Islamist faction Hamas against Israeli towns as a "serious and grave escalation."
articles.title: UAE calls Hamas attacks on Israel a 'serious and grave escalation'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Several U.S. nationals have died since the start of Hamas' surprise attack on Israel on Saturday, a National Security Council spokesman said Sunday, adding that U.S. officials remained in touch with their Israeli counterparts.
articles.title: 'Several' US citizens have died following attacks in Israel, NSC spokesperson says

articles.author: Maayan Lubell, Michael Georgy
articles.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's options for hitting Hamas over its deadly incursion into Israel could be reined in by concern for the many Israelis seized in the raid, as a nation scarred by past hostage crises faces perhaps its worst one yet.
articles.title: Hostages complicate plan for 'mighty vengeance' against Hamas

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas' assault on Israel drove oil prices higher on Monday as markets priced in fears of a wider conflict in the Middle East, a day after Israel pounded the Palestinian enclave of Gaza in retaliation for one of the bloodiest attacks in its history.
articles.title: Israel retaliates after Hamas attacks, deaths pass 1,100

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The violence in Israel will likely prompt a move into safe-haven assets as investors closely watch events in the Middle East to gauge geopolitical risk to markets.
articles.title: Attack on Israel likely to boost appeal of gold, safe-haven assets

articles.author: Gary Mcwilliams
articles.description: The head of Exxon Mobil's (XOM.N) shale oil and gas business, a unit involved in merger talks with rival Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD.N), was arrested at a Texas hotel last week on a sexual assault charge, police said.
articles.title: Head of Exxon's shale oil business faces sexual assault charge in Texas
